steps.title: Pick out a nice grapefruit at the store.
steps.content: Pick out a nice grapefruit at the store. Grapefruits should be hard, but not too hard. Grapefruits don't ripen much once they are picked, so choose wisely. steps.title: Wash the grapefruit
steps.content: Wash the grapefruit . [2] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Sprinkle it with sugar or salt if desired.
steps.content: Sprinkle it with sugar or salt if desired.

steps.title: Insert a spoon (ideally one which is serrated at the tip) in the grapefruit and take out a chunk.
steps.content: Insert a spoon (ideally one which is serrated at the tip) in the grapefruit and take out a chunk. Take a bite, avoiding the bitter, hard-to-chew "walls" separating the grapefruit's segments. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Dispose of the peel in an environmentally friendly way such as composting.
steps.content: Dispose of the peel in an environmentally friendly way such as composting.

steps.title: Use an alternative method.
steps.content: Use an alternative method. If this method if too messy for you or you dislike the amount of rind you encounter, use the method below or try segmenting the grapefruit.

steps.title: Using a small knife, cut the grapefruit in half.
steps.content: Using a small knife, cut the grapefruit in half. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Cut each half into wedges.
steps.content: Cut each half into wedges. Cut each half in half again and repeat until standard wedges are produced. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Cut along the rind to remove just the fruit.
steps.content: Cut along the rind to remove just the fruit.

steps.title: Cut the wedge in half and remove the center pips.
steps.content: Cut the wedge in half and remove the center pips.

steps.title: Eat it on salad.
steps.content: Eat it on salad. Grapefruit goes great on salad. Cut up pieces using the method above and mix with arugula (or the salad of your choice), feta cheese, walnuts and a small amount of vinaigrette for a healthy and delicious meal. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Grill grapefruit.
steps.content: Grill grapefruit. You can easily grill grapefruit to caramelize the natural sugars and bring out the flavor. Either cut it in half and grill it face-side down for 5 minutes or cut it into circular slices and grill 2 minutes (or until it appears done). Top with honey for a healthy grill treat. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Turn it into salsa.
steps.content: Turn it into salsa. If you like orange or mango salsa, give grapefruit salsa a try. Dice the fruit and mix with lime, caramelized onions, diced jalapeno, and diced avocado. You can put this on crackers, use it to top salmon, a salad, or anywhere else you'd normally use salsa. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Juice it.
steps.content: Juice it. You can juice the grapefruit and use it in a variety of ways. Replace the lime to produce grapefruit margaritas. [9] X Research source Drink it straight or with a little water for a tart summer treat. Pour it over chicken and pan-sear for a twist on lemon-chicken.

steps.title: If you haven't tried grapefruit before, be cautious when eating it.
steps.content: If you haven't tried grapefruit before, be cautious when eating it. You could be allergic.
